Fields.DialogueText: *KABOOM*
We're under siege! To your positions!
Makasete, Kanchou! I've been itching to blow off some steam!
@BATTLE
Wah! Kimochi yokatta!
I can't think of very many Belles that exult so much in the sound of explosions. Especially those that aren't destroyers.
Tasshikani, ne! I suppose I'm just happy to be out and about.
Well, so long as you keep up the fine work, I see no problems with you letting loose a little.
Azassu, Kanchou!

Fields.MenuText: I did notice a few planes doing barrel rolls earlier. Care to explain?

Fields.DialogueText: Those pilots are all so by-the-books, don't you think? They should learn to enjoy their work more and if I can nudge them in the right direction, what's the harm?!
Are we using the word "nudge" literally or figuratively in this context?

Fields.MenuText: However, let's try and keep the rampaging to a minimum at least in front of the crew.

Fields.DialogueText: Eh?! Demo, Kanchou, surely I'm setting a good example!

Fields.MenuText: Just be careful out there. Too much chaos might force you into the drydock for repairs.

Fields.DialogueText: *Shiver* Kanchou, please, don't speak of such things!
That will be all for today. Come by my office when you have the chance for debriefing of our next assignment.
Hai!
Kanchou? You wanted to see me?
Ah, yes, have a seat. I've gotten word of our next assignment.
Yatta! What is it this time? A high-speed pursuit?! A tactical blindside?!
Let's see here... We'll be escorting--
A destroyer and have to provide backup?!?!
We'll be escorting a convoy ship carrying damaged and disused planes.
... Come again?
Yes, it seems the ship isn't large enough to carry all the planes - and so we'll be not only taking on some of their excess but ensuring they reach their destination safely.
May I see the transcript, Kanchou...?
Hm? Oh, by all means.
Blah, blah "escort". Blah, blah, "by-the-books". Blah, blah, "possibility of danger unlikely"?! Ugh!

Fields.MenuText: Something the matter?

Fields.DialogueText: Will I get in trouble from the higher-ups for complaining?
Probably.
Then, no.

Fields.MenuText: Not every mission is going to be death and destruction, I'm afraid.

Fields.DialogueText: Forgive me for thinking we'd see a little more action. It isn't like we're in the midst of an interspecies war or anything!
*ALARM*

Fields.MenuText: If you do well, this will be an excellent way for you to gain favor with our superiors.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? If you put it like that, I guess I won't complain.
Morganas! Please, join me on the deck. This may be your last real battle for sometime so let's make the most of it!
Hai!
@BATTLE
We should be arriving at the port town momentarily. We'll meet with the owner of the cargo ship and set sail thereafter.
Wakatta.
Not still down and out about the whole affair, are you?
Gomenne, Kanchou. Saki no. I just get a bit overexcited at times. I still can't believe I'm here and able to fight like this.
Ah, yes, I received word of your service history. It didn't look all that compelling.
You can say that again.

Fields.MenuText: Would you care to elaborate?
Have you moved past it?
Well, you're here now. That's all that matters.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know the full story but, apparently, I was constructed poorly to get around treaty obligations. I then spent most of my early life being modified to be of any use whatsoever.
How awful.
It was very painful both physically and mentally. Still, I'm sure they had their reasons. I'm not sure exactly what I did to upset them but I hope I can redeem myself going forward!
Mochiron! I'm proving my worth and that's all that matters!
You bet!
What happened, exactly?
*ALARM*
Morganas! Let's move!
I'm right behind you!
@BATTLE
Are you sure you're comfortable telling me all this?
Hm? Nande?
isn't it a little too... personal?
Yoku wakannai, Kanchou. You asked me a question so I answered!
Oh... Very well... (Could Japan's intel be at risk with such naivety guarding it...)
So, that's what that sound was. I didn't know you could play the sax.
Ah, Kanchou! Bikkurishita. I can't really. I'm trying my best to learn.

Fields.MenuText: How long have you been practicing?
Why the interest?
Can you play me something?

Fields.DialogueText: Muri, muri, muri! Hazukashisugi!
Ha! Maybe after you've gotten a little better.
Jitsu wa, I heard Sōryū-senpai plays the sax and it sounded really cool!
Not too long. I'm hoping to get better and impress Sōryū-senpai!
Senpai? Didn't you and Sōryū awaken around the same time?
Demo, Sōryū-senpai wa kakkosugiru! I can't help but aspire to be as cool as her someday!
*ALARM*
We'll have to save the recital for later. We've got company!
This is one avenue where Sōryū-senpai and I can be considered equals!
@BATTLE
Wah! Kimochii!
The sun is really beating down today. That's a good sign for things to come.
The cargo ship kanchou was also very nice, wasn't he?
That he was. Now, we should probably get back to work.
Chotto mate, Kanchou! Aren't you forgetting something?
Am I?
Our new ally recommended we peruse the local wares of this town before heading out, did he not?
I was hoping you'd forgotten about that. We aren't likely to run into much trouble on this mission.
Still, it's better to be safe than sorry! Shall we pick up some new weaponry just to be sure?

Fields.MenuText: Very well.

Fields.DialogueText: Yatta! Hayaku, Kanchou, before they sell out!

Fields.MenuText: I think we'll be fine as is.

Fields.DialogueText: Shōganai, ne. But you have to be the one to tell the kanchou that you refused to comply with his suggestion!
Come now, we'll deal with any Morganas blocking our exit and set sail in the morning.
Hai!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Let's keep it regulation for now. We don't want Command's intel on our parameters to be outdated.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose you're right, Kanchou. There's more to us than just hauling cargo, isn't there?
*KNOCK KNOCK KNOCK*
Who in their right mind is knocking on my door at this hour?!
*CREAAK*
Konbanwa, Kanchou!
Is this a dream?
Want me to pinch you to find out?
OW!
Definitely not a dream!
Then it must be a nightmare...
Omoshiroi ne! Ojamashimasu~!
It's three in the morning. What are you doing here?
I can't sleep! We're going to get started with the mission from tomorrow, ne? I can't keep still!

Fields.MenuText: Our missions isn't particularly exciting.

Fields.DialogueText: Who knows what we might uncover! Every mission has the potential for surprise!

Fields.MenuText: Can't you find something to keep you occupied?

Fields.DialogueText: The crew all got tired of pretending to be the sheep to my dragon and went to bed. It's like, you singe one person's backside in the heat of the moment and suddenly "you've gone too far."
Singe?
Un. With a lighter.
Dare I ask?
i was trying to get into character!
*ALARM*

Fields.MenuText: Can I expect these kinds of late-night calls every time we have an upcoming mission?

Fields.DialogueText: Only if the mission itself looks to be entertaining. So, considering that's every mission, I'd say yes!
Lucky for you, I now have to get up anyway. Count your blessings that the Morganas saved your skin from a serious scolding.
I'll have to pay them back and then some! Luckily, I've got a whole tray of knuckle sandwiches ready for dispatch!
@BATTLE
Shuppatsu!
Oi, oi, who's the Kanchou here?
Tehe, sumimasen. I'm just ready to get to work!
The cargo ship looks to be slowing down a little. Can you see anything on the horizon?
Morganas! Steadily approaching!
Damn it all!
What are your orders?

Fields.MenuText: Can we outrun them?
Can we fight them?
Can we slip by unnoticed?

Fields.DialogueText: We're the only two vessels out here, Kanchou! Suffice it to say, we've likely already been spotted!
Who are you talking to?!
So be it! Full steam ahead!
Not while successfully protecting the cargo!
Leave it to me, Kanchou! I've been itching to go a little wild!
@BATTLE
Phew! That looks to be the last of them!
Ryūjō, a word.
Something wrong, Kanchou?
You tell me. Care to take a look around?
I... I'm not following.
The deck is in disarray, half the crew are injured, and I believe there's a fire that has yet to be put out at the other end of the ship! Can you see how dangerous such reckless behavior can be?
Hm?
Oh, right! Mortality! What a bummer. Being human sounds like a real drag.

Fields.MenuText: If you continue to act like this, people will get hurt.

Fields.DialogueText: Are you angry with me, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: I hope you can control yourself in the future.
We don't all have nine lives like you.

Fields.DialogueText: *Sigh* I'm not angry...
Please don't say it!
I'm just disa--
Yamete! *ears plugged* LA LA LA LA!
Disappointed!
... Wakatta. Koko kara moto ganbaru.
That's all I ask. We can't have the whole crew entering an early grave, right? Who would play the sheep to your dragon?
Actually, Kanchou, we're in dire need of a shepherd for the next battle. Someone about your build.
I'll see what I can do.
@BATTLE
Mada mada mada! I'm not letting up until the last one falls!
Ryūjō? Am I interrupting?
Not at all, Kanchou! You're welcome to stay and watch provided you don't try to ogle me.
I wouldn't dream of it. What are you up to?
Taking what you said before to heart, I thought I could perhaps channel some self-control into my combat via dance practice.
I see.
When I dance, I always feel in complete control and, if I can tap into why that is, perhaps I can apply it to field missions.

Fields.MenuText: I didn't mean for you to change yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: Shitteru, shitteru! Don't worry, Kanchou, you won't get rid of this hurrican so easily. However, I would like to ensure my crew aren't injured by my actions.

Fields.MenuText: What type of dance is this?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not sure if you could name it. I prefer just moving to the rhythm.

Fields.MenuText: I had no idea you were so... limber.

Fields.DialogueText: Oi, oi, Kanchou, what was our one rule?! Keep those eyes where I can see them.
*ALARM*
Shall we put this theory to the test?
Onegai!
@BATTLE
I have to say, that was very impressive. I could tell you were much more aware of your surroundings this time around.
Really? Yatta!
If you can somehow manage to balance your chaotic side and rational side, you'll become a even stronger.
Oho, Kanchou, you haven't even SEEN my full potential yet!

Fields.MenuText: Okay, okay, let's not get too cocky.

Fields.DialogueText: Tehe, wakatta!

Fields.MenuText: Osoroshii.
Can I have a sneak preview?

Fields.DialogueText: Ne! The Morganas are the ones who should be afraid though!
Once you come up with satisfactory compensation, I'd be happy to put on a presentation for you.
We'll be making our first stop soon. We'll resupply at the port town up ahead before continuing on. There already look to be a few Morganas circling the entrance.
Iiyo. We can also check in to see how the cargo ship is doing.
Look at you, you little forward thinker you.
I could get used to all these compliments, Kanchou. Kiotsukete.
@BATTLE
I just spoke with the cargo team and they seem happy with our performance so far...
Is there something you're not telling me?
There were murmurs of a few crew members adjusting their wills after seeing me rampage, but I made sure to squash it.
If they're okay to continue onward, then I have no complaints.
I suppose now would be a bad time to ask for more firepower, wouldn't it? I had some ideas for better planes...

Fields.MenuText: That it would.

Fields.DialogueText: Curse my inability to predict the future! I wouldn't have gone so wild if I knew we'd be resupplying so soon!

Fields.MenuText: It can't be helped.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, you're too good to me!
Quickly, now, there's no time to lose. We need to head back out to sea at once.
I believe a few Morganas are still in the area, Kanchou. Allow me to extricate them!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Worry about what's going through the Morganas' heads, not the crew's.

Fields.DialogueText: Ideally some shells, Kanchou!
So boooooooored.
It can't be helped; such is the nature of escort missions.
I hope we don't come across any Funayūrei!
What are you doing?
Trying to tempt fate. Maybe something interesting will happen.

Fields.MenuText: I don't think fate will bend to your whim like that. Even if it understood you, I wouldn't think it so foolish.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't underestimate reverse psychology, Kanchou. It can be a pretty powerful manipulation tool.
I'm not buying it.
Sorry for my disobedience. Please don't send me to my room before finishing my chores as punishment!
That's exactly what I'm going to...! Touché.

Fields.MenuText: Can't you enjoy one of the few rare respites we have?

Fields.DialogueText: I'll rest when I'm dead, Kanchou! That's what Sōryū-senpai always says!
*ALARM*

Fields.MenuText: Nothing is happe--

Fields.DialogueText: Mate, Kanchou. Give it some time... The forces of nature are just as busy as we are.
Finally! Ittekuru!
Wait, what happened to exercising restrai--and she's gone.
@BATTLE
Tadaima...
Uh-huh.
Let me explain!
Please do.
Really? I never thought I'd get this far.
I'm waiting.
About halfway through the battle, I realized what I'd done. I hope you can forgive me.
I'm not going to forgive you.
Kanchou, please! I can do better next time! I just need a little more--
I'd like you to forgive me.
Watching you out there take on those Morganas in record time. I can see my advice will only hold you back.
But what about destroying everything I set my eyes on?
I'll make sure to evacuate the area and clean up after you're done. That's what allies are for.
Kanchou...

Fields.MenuText: Are... are you--?

Fields.DialogueText: Baka! There's something in my eye!

Fields.MenuText: Does that sound good to you?
Keep up the good work.

Fields.DialogueText: Too good to be true almost. I'm still waiting for the catch.
Hai! Mochiron!
*ALARM*
I guess I don't need to ask for your permission anymore before a fight.
Like you ever did!
@BATTLE
You're already looking back to your old self!
Yosha! I'll be like Sōryū-senpai in no time!

Fields.MenuText: What is it about Sōryū that you admire so much?
Is there any other Belle you aspire to be like?

Fields.DialogueText: Sōryū-senpai is so free-spirited! She doesn't take anything from anyone! I wish I could be like that!
Yūbari-senpai exhibits them same kind of free-spiritedness that I admire. I could never keep such a straight face after disobeying my superiors so blatantly!

Fields.MenuText: Look out, here comes an Imperial Officer!

Fields.DialogueText: Gah! Gomennasai! It was all Sōryū-senpai's doing! She forced me to... Hidoi yo, Kanchou...
Ha! You aren't there quite yet.
*ALARM*
Morganas! Let's get to work!
Hai!
@BATTLE
Kanchou! Can you come in here for a moment?
What's the matter?
I'm currently in comms with the cargo ship. They say we won't be stopping again until the final destination.
I see.
It seems they'd like to offer us some of their weaponry at a discounted price. This will be the ship's last mission and all the weapons will be sold after this.
So we can get in now for a cheaper deal or wait and pay full price later.
Exactly. The kanchou has been impressed with our resilience so far and is happy to do business with us directly. What should I tell him?

Fields.MenuText: I can hardly say no to that.

Fields.DialogueText: Wakatta! I'll let him know.

Fields.MenuText: It's too shady for my liking. It could ruin my reputation.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah! Of course, I hadn't thought of that!
*ALARM*
Extra weapons or not, these Morganas won't stand a chance against us!
Hai! Ikō!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: If it's not through official channels, it's contraband.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose it is already earmarked for disposal. Still seems like a waste...
These Morganas just don't know when to quit!
I've dealt with most of them, Kanchou. All that leaves is...
A sole straggler in the distance. Let's dispatch it quickly and--
Whoa, Kanchou! Where's the fire? Let's have some fun with it.

Fields.MenuText: What do you propose?

Fields.DialogueText: Let's shoot some near-misses and watch it dance!

Fields.MenuText: Have you always been this sadistic?

Fields.DialogueText: Only when I know I can get away with it!

Fields.MenuText: That doesn't sound very ethical...

Fields.DialogueText: War is no place to get out the rulebook, Kanchou. It's about sending a message! "We are stronger than you and aren't afraid to show it!"
Very well. Have your fill of torture. Just don't expect me to sit around and watch.
Anshinshite, Kanchou! I'll be sure to drop by your quarters later and describe everything to you in excruciating detail!
@BATTLE
*KNOCK KNOCK KNOCK*
Again at this ungodly hour...
*REEEEAK*
What is it this time?
Oh, Kanchou. Am I interrupting?
Yes.
That's a relief. I'll make myself comfortable then.
What's wrong this time?
Nothing...
It's 3 in the morning. This is no time to be coy.
Hai. What you said earlier... Did you mean it?

Fields.MenuText: Of course.
Refresh my memory.
Probably not.

Fields.DialogueText: Mō, Kanchou. Take this seriously, I know you don't know what I'm talking about.
You've forgotten already?
Stop trying to get me to leave by making me mad!
Go on then.
You said you would support me from now on, right?
That sounds like something I'd say.
Everytime I think back to my early life... All I can see is a blur of pain and anguish.
Ryūjō...
Why would I be designed from the ground up to be a failure? Why would I be put through so many hardships by my creators? Why...
Why?
Why do I not hate them and, instead, want to dedicate my life to earn their respect?
It's natural to love one's parents no matter how toxic they may be.
Am I being too naive?
Your naivety is what makes you so endearing.
Gee, thanks... My ditziness makes me cute.
Not like that! Listen, I won't tell you what you're supposed to do. That's for you to figure out in life. What I will do, is be there to cheer you on from the sidelines.
*ALARM*
Azassu, Kanchou! Sorry for bothering you. Let me handle the Morganas as compensation!
Go get 'em!
Hai!
@BATTLE
We're almost at the final stop!
All in all, I'd say this escort mission was a complete--
Kanchou, dame! You're tempting fate!
Please! What could possibly go...
*KABOOM*
*KABOOM*
*KABOOM*
*ALARM*
We're under attack! Where's the cargo ship?!
Kanchou, mite!

Fields.MenuText: You're kidding....
We were so close...
Is anyone still...

Fields.DialogueText: I can't imagine anything living through such a barrage...
No one could make it out alive after such a barrage.
I'm not detecting any life signs.
Damn Morganas!
Gomen, Kanchou! When I said I wanted action, I didn't mean it like this! I didn't want for anyone to get hurt!
This is no time for talk! We need to fight back or we'll be next!
Hai!
@BATTLE
I'll hold them off for as long as I can! See if you can find any survivors below the sea!
@BATTLE
The Morganas just keep coming! Any luck, Kanchou?
See for yourself.
The kanchou's hat... So, that means...

Fields.MenuText: We failed in our mission to escort them safely.

Fields.DialogueText: Snap out of it, We're not out of the woods just--
Uso... Yappari, I'm nothing but a failure.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry, I failed you as your superior.

Fields.DialogueText: Iie, Kanchou... Yappari, I'm no good for anything...

Fields.MenuText: None of the crew survived.

Fields.DialogueText: This was only supposed to be a simple escort mission. Maybe I'm not as ready for the front lines as I thought I was...
*KABOOM*
Kanchou? Kanchou! Kanchou, okite!
*THUD*
Kanchou... onegai... I can't do this alone...
*KABOOM*
Okay, you're responsible for the death of an entire crew, there's a horde of ghost ships coming to murder you, and the only person that has your back is unconscious.
Wakkanai! What would the Kanchou say in such a situation?

Fields.MenuText: "I believe in you."

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou really is a softie.

Fields.MenuText: "Show them what you've got!"

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou always did believe in me. Maybe I should let loose for real this time.

Fields.MenuText: "Don't do anything crazy."

Fields.DialogueText: Reverse psychology strikes again!
Anshinshite, Kanchou. I won't let anyone take you away from me.
@BATTLE
What the... I must have passed out... Ryūjō! Where is...
*ROOOOOAAA*

Fields.MenuText: What in the...
Is that a...
Ryūjō...

Fields.DialogueText: *ROOOOOAAA*
Who knew you had such a trick up your sleeve? The scales were certainly a giveaway but who knew you could turn into a living, breathing dragon...
*ROOOOOAAA*
I can't fall behind! I need to support her as best I can!
@BATTLE
Ryūjō! I've got you, I've got you...
Kanchou... Did we win...?

Fields.MenuText: We didn't. YOU did!

Fields.DialogueText: Yokatta...

Fields.MenuText: We won all right!

Fields.DialogueText: I hope the cargo crew can forgive me...

Fields.MenuText: Thanks to you and the magnificent form change!

Fields.DialogueText: Minaide, kudasai... Hazukashii...
Kanchou...
What is it?
Gomen... My naivety cost us the mission and the lives of several crewmen.
The captain is always responsible for the actions of the crew. I accept full responsibility for everything that happened here today. More importantly...
Hai...?
I have never been more proud of you.
Kanchou... You'll make me blush...
Ryūjō...? Ryūjō! Quickly get us out of here and get Ryūjō to the doctor!
@BATTLE
Don't look so glum. This was your first real mission. No one passes their driving test the first time, do they?
The cargo crew were so sweet to me. Even after I endangered their lives, they still praised me and wanted to continue under my supervision. Look where that got them.
Enough!
Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: It wasn't your fault.
War is war. Get used to it.
Those men knew the risks of the mission as did we all.

Fields.DialogueText: I can't help but feel like it was.
Hidosuginai, Kanchou...?
I suppose...
I'll leave you here to be repaired. In the meantime, I'll report to our superiors that I failed in this mission and cost the allies several lives in the process.
Chotto! Kanchou... did you mean what you said earlier...? About--
Every word. Now, rest up. I'll be back soon.
Hai...
Are you feeling any better?
Un! I think I'm pretty much ready to go!
Is that so? And you wouldn't be lying to get out of here early, would you?
What makes you say that...? *profuse sweating*
No reason.
By the way, Kanchou, some of the repairmen working on me said we can find cheap weaponry here. A lot of our resources were lost in the last battle. What do you think?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe we can find a contact for Command to deal with.

Fields.DialogueText: Azassu.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe another time.

Fields.DialogueText: Wakatta.
Everything looks to be in working order. Let's head back out to sea and await our next mission.
Eh? Just like that?
We're at war. No rest for the wicked. We take our scoldings on the chin and move forward. That's what it means to be a sailor.
Hai.
Think you can handle a few Morganas?
Hai!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: We'll manage. I'm more concerned about who's selling arms on the cheap.

Fields.DialogueText: Leaving money on the table?
Or bullets.
Keep at it! The Morganas are nearly sunk!
@BATTLE
You're looking much brighter today.
I'm still getting used to everything, but I'm sure it will come in time.

Fields.MenuText: You never forget those you lost. You must carry their spirits with you.

Fields.DialogueText: It sounds like it can get pretty heavy but I'll do my best!

Fields.MenuText: That's what I like to hear.

Fields.DialogueText: I will learn from my mistakes. I will make you and everyone that ever doubted me proud!

Fields.MenuText: You'll be fine. I'm sure of it.

Fields.DialogueText: Please stand with me until that fateful day comes!
Tokorode, Kanchou...
Yes?
Do you think you could say you were proud of me again...? Just as a confidence booster!
When you do something that warrants being proud of, only then I'll praise you.
Ijiwaru...
No Morganas look to be in the vicinity. I think you can be relieved for a spell.
Great! We're in dire need of a shepherd to fend off the vicious dragon! Will you join me?

Fields.MenuText: I'd love to.
Sure thing!

Fields.DialogueText: Yatta! Just know, I won't hold back!
Jya, ikō!
